Description: Type of submitted information.
A tool used in the research process (i.e. animal model, cell line, etc.)

Description: A unique identifier for the resource.

The RRID, a standard resource identifier that will facilitate interoperability with other databases, and is an increasingly-used identifier for publications https://scicrunch.org/resources if available
The 'canonical' name of the resource
Synonyms of the resource
Type of resource. (e.g. animal model, antibody, plasmid, etc.)
Valid Values: Animal Model, Cell Line, Antibody, Genetic Reagent, Biobank

DependsOn: animalModelId
cellLineId
geneticReagentId
antibodyId
biobankId

Description: Free text description/summary/overview/purpose of the resource.
A large language model-generated summary of the resource (currently generated with gpt-3.5-turbo).
Any known restrictions on use of the resource.
Valid Values: data sharing required, non-commercial use only, re-distribution not permitted, generation of germ line transmitting chimeras not permitted, creation of functional gametes not permitted, generation of interspecies chimeras not permitted, human cloning not permitted, cannot be used for treatment purposes, IRB documentation required, special licencing restrictions (see vendor for more information), unknown

Description: How to acquire a particular resource.
The date that the resource was originally added.
The last update of the resource metadata (not including observations).
Genetic reagents.
DependsOn: Component, geneticReagentId, insertName, insertEntrezId, gRNAshRNASequence, insertSize, insertSpecies, nTerminalTag, cTerminalTag, cloningMethod, 5primeCloningSite, 5primeSiteDestroyed, 3primeCloningSite, 3primeSiteDestroyed, promoter, 5primer, 3primer, vectorBackbone, vectorType, backboneSize, totalSize, bacterialResistance, selectableMarker, copyNumber, growthTemp, growthStrain, hazardous
Properties: geneticReagentId, insertName, insertEntrezId, gRNAshRNASequence, insertSize, insertSpecies, nTerminalTag, cTerminalTag, cloningMethod, 5primeCloningSite, 5primeSiteDestroyed, 3primeCloningSite, 3primeSiteDestroyed, promoter, 5primer, 3primer, vectorBackbone, vectorType, backboneSize, totalSize, bacterialResistance, selectableMarker, copyNumber, growthTemp, growthStrain, hazardous

Description: A unique identifier for the reagent.
Name of the main gene insert in the plasmid.
The entrez gene id for the gene insert
The sequence of the gRNA or shRNA for the gene insert, if present.
Size, in bp, of the gene insert as it is in the plasmid.
Species of the insert
Valid Values: Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, Rattus norvegicus

Description: Any tags on the N terminal 5' end of the gene insert in the plasmid. Only tags that are in frame
Any tags on the C terminal 3' end of the gene insert in the plasmid. Only tags that are in frame
How the vector was constructed. (e.g. restriction enzyme, TOPO cloning, etc.)
Valid Values: Restriction Enzyme, TOPO cloning, Gateway Cloning, Ligation Independent Cloning, Gibson Cloning, Unknown

Description: If Restriction Enzyme was selected as the cloning method, specifies what enzyme was used on the 5' (N-terminal) end of the insert
DependsOn: cloningMethod

Description: If 5' site was destroyed during cloning. (e.g. yes, no, unknown).
Valid Values: Yes, No, Unknown

Description: If Restriction Enzyme was selected as the cloning method, specifies what enzyme was used on the 3' (C-terminal) end of the insert
DependsOn: cloningMethod

Description: If 3' site was destroyed during cloning. (e.g. yes, no, unknown)
Valid Values: Yes, No, Unknown

Description: Promoter driving the expression of the insert in the plasmid
Primer to sequence the 5' end (N-terminal) of the insert
Primer to sequence the 3' end (C-terminal) of the insert.
Name of the backbone the plasmid is built on. (e.g pGBT9)
Primary function of the plasmid. (e.g. mammalian expression, bacterial expression, etc.)
Valid Values: Mammalian Expression, Bacterial Expression, Gateway Entry Clone, Lentiviral, Adenoviral, AAV, RNAi, Luciferase, Cre/Lox, Yeast Expression, Worm Expression, Insect Expression, Plant Expression, Mouse Targeting, CRISPR, TALEN, Synthetic Biology, Transfer Vector, Transposon Vector, Unspecified, Other

Description: Size in bp of the backbone without the insert
Size of vector with insert. Derived from insertSize and backboneSize.
Antibiotic(s) that should be used for selection in bacteria. (e.g. ampicillin, kanamycin, etc.)
Valid Values: Ampicillin, Kanamycin, Chloramphenicol, Tetracycline, Spectinomycin, Hygromycin, Bleocin(Zeocin), Gentamycin, Streptomycin, Nourseothricin(clonNat), Ampicillin and Bleocin (Zeocin), Ampicillin and Kanamycin, Ampicillin and Tetracycline, Ampicillin and Streptomycin, Ampicillin and Spectinomycin, Chloramphenicol and Ampicillin, Chloramphenicol and Bleocin (Zeocin), Chloramphenicol and Tetracycline, Chloramphenicol and Kanamycin, Chloramphenicol and Spectinomycin, Chloramphenicol and Gentamycin, Spectinomycin and Streptomycin, Other

Description: Are there any additional selection markers on this plasmid, for example, any mammalian selection markers or fluorescent proteins?
Valid Values: Neomycin, Puromycin, Hygromycin, Kanamycin, Chloramphenicol, Zeocin, Blasticidin, Gentamicin, TRP1, LEU1, LEU2, URA3, HIS3, Basta, Other

Description: If a plasmid produces a sufficient amount of DNA from a normal miniprep or if plasmid requires special growth conditions or it is difficult to grow. (e.g. high copy, low copy, unknown).
Valid Values: High Copy, Low Copy, Unknown

Description: At what temperature should the bacteria hosting the plasmid be grown
Valid Values: 37 C, 30 C, Room Temperature

Description: The E.Coli strain that should be used to distribute the plasmid. (e.g. DH5alpha, NEB Stable, etc.)
Valid Values: DH5alpha, DH10B, NEB Stable, ccdb Survival, Pir1, Other

Description: Does the unmodified plasmid DNA, either in purified form or when introduced into bacterial or mammalian cells require handling at Biosafety Level 2 or higher?
Valid Values: Yes, No, Unknown

Description: When the observation was.

Description: A 1-5 rating of the reliability of the resource; does the resource produce consistent and reliable results? Does the resource reasonably recapitulate the human disease it is intended to model?
A 1-5 rating of the ease of use of the resource; how easy is it to obtain the resource, comply with any agreements like material transfer agreements, etc?
A link/reference related to the observation being recorded. If the reference has a DOI or PubMed ID, use "publication_id" instead.

Genetic diseases are diseases in which inherited genes predispose to increased risk. The genetic disorders associated with cancer often result from an alteration or mutation in a single gene. The diseases range from rare dominant cancer family syndrome to familial tendencies in which low-penetrance genes may interact with other genes or environmental factors to induce cancer. Research may involve clinical, epidemiologic, and laboratory studies of persons, families, and populations at high risk of these disorders. [ NCI ]
Valid Values: Neurofibromatosis type 1, Neurofibromatosis type 2, Schwannomatosis, No known genetic disorder

Description: Manifestations/symptoms that this resource is used to model (e.g. tumor type, behavioral phenotype, etc.)
The changing of the structure of a gene, resulting in a variant form that may be transmitted to subsequent generations
DependsOn: Component, mutationDetailsId, externalMutationID, alleleType, mutationType, mutationMethod, affectedGeneSymbol, affectedGeneName, sequenceVariation, proteinVariation, animalModelMutation, humanClinVarMutation, chromosome
Properties: mutationDetailsId, externalMutationID, alleleType, mutationType, mutationMethod, affectedGeneSymbol, affectedGeneName, sequenceVariation, proteinVariation, animalModelMutation, humanClinVarMutation, chromosome

Description: A unique identifier for mutation.
An identifier from an organism database such as MGI or other curated variant resource, if available.
The type of the mutation, vocabulary aligned with MGI mutation types, and expanded to include additional types.
Valid Values: Disruption caused by insertion of vector, Duplication, Insertion, Insertion of gene trap vector, Intergenic deletion, Intragenic deletion, Inversion, Loss of heterozygosity (unspecified mechanism), Not Applicable, Not Specified, Nucleotide repeat expansion, Nucleotide substitutions, Other, Single point mutation, Translocation, Transposon insertion, Undefined, Viral insertion, Microdeletion, Homozygous deletion, Loss of heterozygosity (mitotic recombination), Loss of heterozygosity (deletion), Stable knockdown, Exogenous DNA expression

Description: The method used to alter the resource, vocabulary aligned with and expanded upon MGI allele origin types.
Valid Values: Chemically induced (ENU), Chemically induced (other), Chemically and radiation induced, Endonuclease-mediated (CRISPR), Endonuclease-mediated (TALEN), Gene trapped, QTL, Radiation induced, Spontaneous, Targeted, Transgenic, Transposon induced, Unknown

Description: The type of genetic alteration of the resource, vocabulary aligned with MGI allele subtypes.
Valid Values: Conditional ready, Constitutively active, Dominant negative, Humanized sequence, Hypomorph, Inducible, Inserted expressed sequence, Knockdown, Modified isoform(s), No functional change, Null/knockout, Recombinase, Reporter, RMCE-Ready, Transactivator, Transposase, Transposon concatemer

Description: The gene symbol for the mutated gene. (e.g. NF1, SUZ12, SMARCB1, P53, etc.)
Gene name for the affected gene (e.g. neurofibromin 1)
Important sequence variations (e.g. g.123_127del). See http://varnomen.hgvs.org/ for the sequence variation nomenclature.
The protein consequence of the mutation described in sequence variations. (e.g. p.Asn58fs). See http://varnomen.hgvs.org/recommendations/protein/ for the Protein Variation nomenclature.

A description of the specific mutation(s) created in the genome. (e.g. A neomycin resistance cassette replaced the first 42 codons of exon 31, the exon 31 splice acceptor site, and approximately 2 kb of intron 30.)
The human equivalent, of the mutation being described in ClinVar/HGVS notation. Can be used to link animal model mutations to the mutation they are modeling in human disease.
Chromosome number of affected gene. (e.g. 11)
(intermediary table)
DependsOn: Component, mutationId, mutationDetailsId, animalModelId, cellLineId

Description: A unique identifier for the mutation burden of the resource.
An animal sufficiently like humans in its anatomy, physiology, or response to a pathogen to be used in medical research in order to obtain results that can be extrapolated to human medicine.
DependsOn: Component, animalModelId, donorId, transplantationDonorId, animalState, backgroundStrain, backgroundSubstrain, strainNomenclature, generation, transplantationType, animalModelGeneticDisorder, animalModelOfManifestation
Properties: animalModelId, donorId, animalState, backgroundStrain, backgroundSubstrain, strainNomenclature, generation, transplantationType, transplantationDonorId, animalModelGeneticDisorder, animalModelOfManifestation

Description: A unique identifier for the animal model.
State the animal is in according to the vendor/developer. (e.g. embryo, sperm, live)

An assigned name that describes the genetic make-up (all its alleles at all loci) except the mutated gene of interest and a very small amount of other genetic material, generally from one or two other strains. Correct strain nomenclature indicates what a mutant strain’s background is.
The substrain is a particular variety of a strain. For example, a C57BL/6 mice may have a substrain of C57BL/6J, C57BL/6Tac, or another substrain.

The standard nomenclature for the strain. (e.g. B6.129S2-NF1tm1Tyj/J). Set by the International Committee on Standardized Genetic Nomenclature for Mice. See http://www.informatics.jax.org/mgihome/nomen/strains.shtml for nomenclature information.
The generation of the animal model. (e.g. 13)
Type of transplantation involved in the experiment, derived from MESH
Valid Values: allograft, xenograft, autograft, isograft

Description: The donor indentifier number for the transplantion donor.
DependsOn: donorId
